description:
Evaluation of Current and Potential Contracts-

  • Review contractual commitments and customer specifications;
  • Determine logistics support requirements, such as facility details and staffing needs;
  • Conduct logistics studies or analysis, such as time studies, zero-base analyses, rate analyses, network analyses, flow-path analyses, or supply chain analyses;
  • Analyze logistics data involving forecasting, procurement, inventory, transportation, or warehousing;
  • Create models or scenarios to predict the impact of changing circumstances, such as fuel costs, road pricing, energy taxes, or other regulations;
  • Evaluate effectiveness of current or future logistical processes;
  • Create models or scenarios to predict the impact of changing circumstances, such as fuel costs, road pricing, or other factors;

Evaluation of Effectiveness of Facility-

  • Prepare daily and weekly reports to other departments regarding the status on cost, schedule, and workload requirements;
  • Develop and maintain standard operating procedures to streamline operating processes;
  • Determine logistic support sequences and time phasing, and other factors affecting the supply chain of any given contract;
  • Evaluate existing systems and models of operation;
  • Evaluate the use of inventory tracking technology and web-based warehousing software to maximize facility efficiency;
  • Collaborate and develop supplier base with local and international shipping suppliers;
  • Propose logistics solutions for management;
  • Research and Improvement of Transportation and Supply Chain Processes-
  • Review global, national, or regional transportation or logistics reports for ways to improve efficiency;
  • Identify cost-reduction or process-improvement logistic opportunities;
  • Prepare logistic strategies or conceptual designs for warehousing facilities; AND
  • Prepare recommendations of operating procedures to management.

Requirements:

  • Majors And/Or Fields(S) Of Study Required: Logistics, Engineering, Business Analytics, Statistics, Supply Chain Management, Or Related
  • Analytical Skills
  • Critical-Thinking Skills
  • Software/Programs: Microsoft Office, Sql, Tableau, Python, Google Data Studio, And Autocad

Benefits & Compensation:

  • 401(k) matching
  • Health insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • Paid time off (PTO): vacation, sick, and holidays
  • Coffee and Snack
  • On-site gym and game rooms
  • Employee Discount
  • 68K-105K
